s.text: This is further evident, the editorial says, in the way Clinton has brushed aside Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu since Wye.

In an editorial, the Times praised the strong, unified action of the British and the Americans and said it was time to seize this opportunity while a large force is assembled in the Gulf and Iraq is apparently in retreat.
The Israeli paper Ha'aretz says if the United States had struck against Iraq, it would have spelled disaster for President Clinton's visit to the Gaza Strip next month.
The Israeli paper Ha'aretz says if the United States had struck against Iraq, it would have spelled disaster for President Clinton's visit to the Gaza Strip next month.
The piece also recommended that with Britain and the United States now apparently in the driver's seat, it is time to review the sanctions.
The Israeli paper Ha'aretz says if the United States had struck against Iraq, it would have spelled disaster for President Clinton's visit to the Gaza Strip next month.
Netanyahu responded by saying that Arafat's stance "endangers the entire Oslo agreement and casts a very dark shadow over the Wye agreement as well."
